<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pro-rata annual bonus payment calculated based on actual performance for the year of termination; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reimbursement of COBRA payments for up to 18 months on the terms. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s severance benefits are not subject to mitigation or offset of future or potential earnings. The agreement also
contains customary covenants regarding confidentiality, non-disclosure, non-competition, non-solicitation, non-disparagement, and proprietary rights. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith Dated November&nbsp;12, 2013 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On November&nbsp;12, 2013, the company entered into a 2013 Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Smith. Pursuant to the agreement, the company granted Mr.&nbsp;Smith on
November&nbsp;12, 2013, an option to purchase 1,500,000 shares of company common stock at an exercise price of $5.21 per share, the closing price of the common stock on the NYSE on November&nbsp;12, 2013. The option will vest and become exercisable
with respect to 33% of the option shares on each of the first three anniversaries of the grant date. No portion of the option may be exercised after the options expiration date of November&nbsp;12, 2023. Except as otherwise provided in the
agreement, the option is subject to all the terms and conditions of the Office Depot, Inc. 2007 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;2007 Plan&#148;). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In general, upon termination of Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s employment, the portion of the option that is unvested on the termination date will be forfeited and cancelled upon termination and the portion of
the option that is vested and exercisable will remain exercisable until the earlier of the expiration date and the date that is 12 months after the termination date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">However, if Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s employment with the company and its subsidiaries is terminated in certain circumstances, the option may vest or be forfeited and cancelled on other terms as described
in the agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, the option is subject to transfer restrictions and is subject to Mr.&nbsp;R.
Smith&#146;s compliance with the non-compete, confidentiality and non-solicitation covenants in his employment agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As
used in this description of the agreement and in the below descriptions of the RSU Agreement and the Performance Shares Agreement, the terms &#147;Cause,&#148; &#147;Disability,&#148; &#147;Good Reason&#148; and &#147;Change in Control&#148; have
the meanings given to them in Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s employment agreement. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">65 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith Dated November&nbsp;12, 2013 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On November&nbsp;12, 2013, the effective date, the company also entered into a 2013 Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;R.
Smith. Pursuant to the agreement, the company granted Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith 1,199,616 RSUs on November&nbsp;12, 2013. The RSUs will vest on the third anniversary of the effective date of the agreement, if Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith is continuously employed by
the company or any subsidiary of the company from November&nbsp;12, 2013 until the third anniversary of the effective date of the agreement. The company will pay the vested portion of the RSUs to Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith within 30 days after his separation
from service with the company and its subsidiaries (or six-months after his separation from service, if such delay is required by Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (&#147;Section 409A&#148;)), and any unvested
portion of the RSUs will be forfeited on the date of such payment. Each payable RSU will be paid by the issuance to Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith of one share of company common stock. Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the RSUs are subject to all
the terms and conditions of the 2003 OMIPP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In general, upon Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s separation from service with the
company and its subsidiaries, the RSUs that are unvested on the separation date will be immediately forfeited. However, if Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith separates from service with the company and its subsidiaries in certain circumstances, the RSUs may vest on
other terms as described in his agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, the RSUs may not be transferred and are subject to
Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s compliance with the non-compete, confidentiality and non-solicitation covenants in his employment agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Performance Stock Unit Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith Dated November&nbsp;12, 2013 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On November&nbsp;12, 2013, the company entered into a 2013 Performance Share Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith. Pursuant to the
agreement, on the November&nbsp;12, 2013, the effective date, the company granted Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith the right to earn shares of company common stock based upon satisfaction of certain performance measures. The target number of performance shares is
1,199,616. Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the performance shares are subject to all the terms and conditions of the 2003 OMIPP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith is eligible to earn up to 150% of his target award based on the level of the company&#146;s achievement of performance measures for the performance period beginning on January&nbsp;1,
2014, and ending on December&nbsp;31, 2016 relative to threshold, target and maximum performance levels established by the Compensation Committee. If the company does not achieve the threshold performance level for a performance measure, the
performance shares associated with that performance measure will be forfeited. If the company&#146;s achievement level is at least equal to a performance measure&#146;s threshold level, Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith will be eligible to receive a portion of the
performance shares associated with the performance measure in an amount based on an interpolation model specified by the Compensation Committee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee will determine based on the company&#146;s achievement the number of performance shares, if any, that Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith is eligible to earn, as soon as practicable after the
performance period. In general, Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith will vest in the eligible award on the date the Compensation Committee determines the eligible award if he remains continuously employed by the company or any subsidiary of the company during the
performance period, and he will immediately forfeit the performance shares upon his termination of such employment prior to the end of the performance period. However, if Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s employment with the company and its subsidiaries is
terminated prior to the end of the performance period due to his death or Disability or without Cause or for Good Reason, Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith will vest in a pro-rata portion of the eligible award (if any) calculated on the basis set forth in the
agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of a Change in Control, (i)&nbsp;with respect to any portion of the performance shares associated
with performance measures that are market-based (as specified in agreement), performance shall be measured as of the effective date of the Change in Control, and (ii)&nbsp;with respect to any portion of the performance shares associated with
non-market-based performance measures (as specified in the agreement), performance shall be deemed to be achieved at target. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">66 </FONT></P>

Compensation Committee determines the award if he remains continuously employed by the company or any subsidiary of the company from November&nbsp;12, 2013 through the end of the performance period, and he will immediately forfeit the award upon his
termination of such employment prior to the end of the performance period. However, if Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s employment with the company and its subsidiaries is terminated in certain circumstances, the award may vest or be forfeited on other
terms as described in agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, the performance shares may not be transferred and are subject to
Mr.&nbsp;

<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Non-Qualified Stock Option Award Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Hare Dated December&nbsp;2, 2013 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On December&nbsp;2, 2013, the company also entered into an option agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Hare. Pursuant to the agreement, the company
granted Mr.&nbsp;Hare an option to purchase 500,000 shares of company common stock at an exercise price of $5.35 per share, the common stock&#146;s closing price on the NYSE on December&nbsp;2, 2013. The option would vest and become exercisable with
respect to 33% of the option shares on each of the first and second anniversaries of the grant date and as to all remaining option shares on the third anniversary of the grant date, provided that Mr.&nbsp;Hare is continuously employed by the company
or a subsidiary of the company on each such anniversary date. No portion of the option may be exercised after its expiration date of December&nbsp;2, 2023. Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the option is subject to all the terms and
conditions of the 2007 Plan. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">67 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In general, upon termination of Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s employment prior to the third
anniversary of the option&#146;s grant date, the portion of the option that is unvested on the termination date will be forfeited and cancelled. However, if Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s employment with the company and its subsidiaries is terminated in
certain circumstances, the option may vest or be forfeited and cancelled on other terms. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If Mr.&nbsp;Hare terminates
employment (i)&nbsp;by voluntarily terminating employment after completing at least five years of service, (ii)&nbsp;as a result of an involuntary termination without Cause, resignation for Good Reason, death, or termination on account of
Disability, or (iii)&nbsp;due to Retirement (as defined in the 2007 Plan), then the portion of the option that is vested and exercisable on the termination date will remain exercisable until the earlier of its expiration date and the date that is 12
months after the termination date; otherwise, the portion of the option that is vested and exercisable on the date of termination will remain exercisable until the earlier of its expiration date and the date that is 90 days after the termination
date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, the option is subject to transfer restrictions and is subject to Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s
compliance with the non-compete, confidentiality and non-solicitation covenants in the Associate Non-Competition, Confidentiality and Non-Solicitation Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As used in this description of the option agreement and in the below descriptions of the RSU Agreement and the Performance Shares Agreement, the terms &#147;Cause,&#148; &#147;Disability,&#148; &#147;Good
Reason&#148; and &#147;Change in Control&#148; have the meanings given to them in the agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement
with Mr.&nbsp;Hare Dated December&nbsp;2, 2013 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On December&nbsp;2, 2013, the effective date, the company entered into an
RSU agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Hare, pursuant to which the company granted Mr.&nbsp;Hare 229,533 RSUs. The RSUs will vest on the third anniversary of the effective date if Mr.&nbsp;Hare is continuously employed by the company or any subsidiary of the
company from the effective date until the third anniversary of the effective date. Each vested RSU will be paid by the issuance to Mr.&nbsp;Hare of one share of common stock. Except as otherwise provided in the agreement, the RSUs are subject to all
the terms and conditions of the 2003 OMIPP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In general, upon Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s separation from service with the company
and its subsidiaries, the RSUs that are unvested on the separation date will be immediately forfeited. However, if Mr.&nbsp;Hare separates from service with the company and its subsidiaries in certain circumstances, the RSUs may vest on other terms
as described in the agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, the RSUs may not be transferred and are subject to
Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s compliance with the non-compete, confidentiality and non-solicitation covenants in the Associate Non-Competition, Confidentiality and Non-Solicitation Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payment of 18 months of his annual base salary on the date of termination; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is also permitted to bring his spouse on overseas business trips in recognition of the extensive travel required for his
position. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt Dated December&nbsp;16, 2010 and Amended February&nbsp;21, 2013
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Change in Control Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt dated December&nbsp;16, 2010, and amended on
February&nbsp;21, 2013, governs the terms and conditions of Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s employment with the company for the one-year period following the date of a Change in Control. On February&nbsp;21, 2013, the agreement was amended to provide that
the occurrence of the closing of the Merger Agreement will be deemed to constitute a &#147;Change in Control&#148; for the purposes of the Change in Control Agreement. The agreement was also amended so that the severance protection period under the
agreement will continue until second anniversary of the closing. Upon the company&#146;s termination of Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt during the severance protection period, without Cause, or upon Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s resignation for Good Reason prior to the
closing, the agreement provides that Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s severance benefits would be triggered and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt would be eligible to receive the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

payout was 70% of base salary. In January 2014, the Compensation Committee approved an increase in Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s salary to $525,000 and his bonus target payout was increased to 75% of base salary, for the reasons described in the section
entitled, &#147;Post-Merger Compensation Programs.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s employment is terminable at will by either
Mr.&nbsp;Allison or the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s employment is involuntarily terminated by the company for no
fault of his own, he is eligible to receive the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

of claims against the company and its affiliates, and his compliance with the terms of that release. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retention Agreement with
Mr.&nbsp;Allison Dated August&nbsp;21, 2013 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Allison dated
August&nbsp;21, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Allison is eligible to earn a retention payment of up to $500,000 in a single lump sum payment if he remains actively employed until June&nbsp;30, 2014. The retention payment shall be paid to Mr.&nbsp;Allison within 30
days after the retention payment date. If prior to the retention payment date, Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s employment is terminated: (i)&nbsp;by the company as a result of a termination for Cause, or (ii)&nbsp;by Mr.&nbsp;Allison without Good Reason,
the retention payment which has not yet vested shall be immediately forfeited. If Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s employment is involuntarily terminated prior to June&nbsp;30, 2014 by the company for any reason other than Cause, or if Mr.&nbsp;Allison
terminates employment prior to June&nbsp;30, 2014, for Good Reason, such termination shall result in an immediate vesting of the retention payment. Such retention payment shall be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Allison in addition to any severance benefits
that may be payable to Mr.&nbsp;Allison pursuant to the Promotion Letter upon separation from employment or as set forth in the Change in Control Agreement to which Mr.&nbsp;Allison and the company are parties. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Allison Dated February&nbsp;21, 2013 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Allison dated February&nbsp;21, 2013 (which
amended and restated the original Change in Control Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Allison dated July&nbsp;21, 2011) are in accordance with those described above for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, dated May&nbsp;23, 2011. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="toc692145_76"></A>Agreements with Elisa Garcia as Executive Vice President and Chief Legal Officer </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The company&#146;s Executive Vice President, Chief Legal Officer and Secretary, Ms.&nbsp;Elisa&nbsp;D. Garcia C., is employed pursuant to
the terms of a Letter Agreement dated May&nbsp;15, 2007, which was subsequently amended effective December&nbsp;31, 2008 to bring the agreement into documentary compliance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. The company is also party to a Change in
Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Garcia dated December&nbsp;17, 2010. </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pro-rata annual bonus for the year of termination; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target annual bonus for the calendar year prior to the year of termination, if the annual bonus for such year has not yet been paid as of the date of
termination. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s severance entitlements are conditional upon her execution of a release
of claims against the company and its affiliates, and her compliance with the terms of that release. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retention Agreement with
Ms.&nbsp;Garcia Dated November&nbsp;2, 2010 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;Garcia dated
November&nbsp;2, 2010, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia was eligible to earn a retention payment of up to $1,500,000, if she remained actively employed until the last day of the retention period which expired on November&nbsp;1, 2013. The retention payment was
payable to Ms.&nbsp;Garcia in three equal installments of $500,000, with the first payment vested on November&nbsp;1, 2011, the second payment vested on November&nbsp;1, 2012, and the final payment vested on November&nbsp;1, 2013, as long as she
remained actively employed with the company until each redemption payment date. The first payment to Ms.&nbsp;Garcia pursuant to the agreement was made on November&nbsp;10, 2011, the second payment was made on November&nbsp;9, 2012, and the third
payment was made on November&nbsp;1, 2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;Garcia Dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The substantive provisions of the Change in Control Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;Garcia dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 are in
accordance with those described above for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, dated May&nbsp;
23, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="toc692145_77"></A>Agreements with Deborah O&#146;Connor as Senior Vice President, Integration </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Upon the closing of the merger, Ms.&nbsp;Deborah O&#146;Connor, the former OfficeMax Senior Vice President and interim CFO, was appointed
as a co-CFO with Mr.&nbsp;Michael Newman for the combined company. Upon Mr.&nbsp;Stephen&nbsp;E. Hare&#146;s appointment as Executive Vice President and CFO of the company,&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor became co-Chief Accounting Officer of the
company.&nbsp;On December&nbsp;18, 2013, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor was appointed to her new role as the company&#146;s Senior Vice President of Integration.</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">72 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The company has assumed two Retention Bonus Agreements between Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor and
OfficeMax, dated May&nbsp;1, 2013, and July&nbsp;24, 2013, as well as a Change in Control Agreement dated December&nbsp;11, 2008. The company has also entered into a Retention Bonus Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor dated March&nbsp;21, 2014,
effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2014. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Assumed Retention Bonus Agreements with Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor Dated May&nbsp;1, 2013 and
July&nbsp;24, 2013 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention Agreements between OfficeMax and Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor dated May&nbsp;1, 2013 and
July&nbsp;24, 2013, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor is eligible to earn retention payments of up to $225,000 and $100,000, respectively. The retention payments are payable to Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor in two installments. The first installment was divided
equally into time-based and performance-based portions, and vested upon the closing of the merger. The second installment shall vest on May&nbsp;6, 2014, the six-month anniversary of the closing of the merger, provided that Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor is
employed by the company on that date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The retention payments shall be paid in cash (subject to applicable deductions for
income and employment taxes) as soon as possible after each installment vests and in no event later than two and one-half months after such vesting. If prior to the vesting dates, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s employment with the company is
terminated involuntarily by the company or voluntarily by Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor for any reason, any unvested portion of the retention payments shall be immediately cancelled and forfeited. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Change in Control Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor Dated December&nbsp;11, 2008 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Change in Control Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor dated December&nbsp;11, 2008, which amended and restated terms of Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s Letter Agreement dated
July&nbsp;9, 2008, governs the terms and conditions of Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s employment with the company for the one-year period following the date of a Change in Control. A Change in Control is defined in the Change in Control Agreement as
any one of the following events: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If any person (other than an exempt person) is or becomes the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; of greater than 25% of the combined voting power of the
outstanding shares of common stock of the company or the combined voting power of the company&#146;s then outstanding securities; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If during any period of two consecutive years, individuals who were directors at the beginning of the period and any new directors whose election by
the Board or nomination for election by the shareholders was approved by at least two-thirds of the directors then still in office cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the Board; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">73 </FONT></P>

Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s express written consent after a Change in Control of the company: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Assignment of duties materially inconsistent with her responsibilities as an executive officer or a significant adverse alteration in responsibilities
from those in effect immediately prior to the change in control; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the company&#146;s discretion, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor may also receive the following: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

financial counseling services in which she was participating prior to the change in control for 12 months; or </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Lump sum amount equal to 12 times 150% of the sum of the monthly group premium, less the amount of employee contributions, for all insurance plans, as
well as a monthly allowance for financial counseling services and other programs or arrangements. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Retention Bonus
Agreement with Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor Dated March&nbsp;21, 2014, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2014 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the Retention
Agreement between the company and Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor dated as of March&nbsp;21, 2014, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2014, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor is eligible to earn a retention payment of $150,000 in a single lump sum payment if she remains
employed with the company until June&nbsp;30, 2014. The retention payment shall be paid to Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor within 30 days after June&nbsp;30, 2014. If prior to June&nbsp;30, 2014, Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s employment is terminated:
(i)&nbsp;by the company as a result of a termination for Cause (as defined in Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s Change in Control Agreement), or (ii)&nbsp;by Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor without Good Reason (as described below), the retention payment which
has not yet vested shall be immediately forfeited. If Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor&#146;s employment is involuntarily terminated prior to June&nbsp;30, 2014 by the company for any reason other than Cause or if Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor terminates employment
prior to June&nbsp;30, 2014, for Good Reason, such termination shall result in an immediate vesting of the retention payment. Good Reason is defined in the Retention Agreement as, (i)&nbsp;a material diminution of the executive&#146;s authorities,
duties or responsibilities with the company; (ii)&nbsp;a material reduction in the executive&#146;s annual base salary (except for across-the-board salary reductions similarly affecting all executives of the company) or target annual incentive; or
(iii)&nbsp;the company requiring the executive to be based anywhere located more than 50 miles from the primary office location at which the executive was based immediately prior to January&nbsp;1, 2014, except for required travel on company
business to the extent substantially consistent with the executive&#146;s business travel obligations which existed immediately prior to January&nbsp;1, 2014. Such retention payment shall be payable to Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor in addition to any
severance benefits that may be payable to Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor pursuant to the Change in Control Agreement upon separation from employment, to which Ms.&nbsp;O&#146;Connor and the company are parties. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">74 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="toc692145_78"></A>Summary of 2003 OMIPP </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The company assumed the 2003 OMIPP as a result of the merger transaction, and therefore, the Compensation Committee has the authority to
make all determinations deemed necessary or advisable for the administration of the 2003 OMIPP, including: (i)&nbsp;determining the type and number of awards to be granted, the number of shares of stock to which an award may relate, and the
applicable terms, conditions and restrictions; (ii)&nbsp;establishing and administering performance goals and criteria relating to any award; and (iii)&nbsp;providing for forfeiture of outstanding awards. As of December&nbsp;28, 2013, 31,408,135
shares remain available for future grants under the 2003 OMIPP. The 2003 OMIPP may only be used to make awards to new hires (after the merger) and OfficeMax employees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Certain compensation under the 2003 OMIPP is intended to qualify as &#147;performance-based compensation&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Code. There are eight general types of
awards that may be granted under the 2003 OMIPP: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Stock options (including both incentive stock options within the meaning of Section&nbsp;422 of the Code and nonqualified stock options, which are
stock options that do not qualify as incentive stock options); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Stock appreciation rights; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Restricted stock; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Performance units; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Performance shares; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Annual incentive awards; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Stock bonus awards. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board may amend or terminate the 2003 OMIPP at any time. The Compensation Committee may amend or modify the 2003 OMIPP or any award agreements necessary to comply with applicable laws. In addition,
the OMIPP and outstanding awards may be equitably adjusted, without stockholder approval, in the event of any recapitalization, stock split, reverse stock split, reorganization, merger, consolidation, spin-off, combination, share repurchase, share
exchange, reclassification or other similar corporate transaction or event. However, awards outstanding at the termination of the 2003 OMIPP will remain in effect according to their terms and the provisions of the 2003 OMIPP. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except as otherwise provided in an employment agreement, award agreement or change in control agreement, upon both a &#147;change in
control&#148; and a &#147;qualifying termination&#148; (as such terms are defined in the 2003 OMIPP or applicable agreement) the vesting of all outstanding awards (other than annual incentive awards) will be accelerated, except in cases where an
acquiring entity does not assume the awards, in which case only a change in control, but not a qualifying termination, is required to cause acceleration. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><A NAME="toc692145_79"></A>Agreements with Former Executive Officers </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Neil
Austrian, Former Co-Chief Executive Officer </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the 2013 fiscal year, Mr.&nbsp;Neil Austrian served as co-CEO of the
combined company prior to the completion of the merger and until our CEO Selection Committee was able to finalize the terms of employment with our current CEO, Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith. Following Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s appointment as Chairman and CEO on
November&nbsp;12, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Austrian resigned from his position with the company. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">75 </FONT></P>

termination date. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any and all outstanding equity or cash awards issued to Mr.&nbsp;Austrian shall be
governed in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable agreements and respective plans.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Ravi Saligram, Former Co-Chief
Executive Officer </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the 2013 fiscal year, Mr.&nbsp;Ravi Saligram served as co-CEO of the combined company prior to
the completion of the merger and until our CEO Selection Committee was able to finalize the terms of employment with our current CEO, Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith. Following Mr.&nbsp;R. Smith&#146;s appointment as Chairman and CEO on November&nbsp;12, 2013,
Mr.&nbsp;Saligram resigned from his position with the company. From November 2010 until November 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Saligram was the president and CEO of OfficeMax. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Michael Newman, Former Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Prior to the completion of the merger, Mr.&nbsp;Michael Newman was the company&#146;s Executive Vice President and CFO. Upon the
completion of the merger in November 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Newman was appointed, along with Ms.&nbsp;Deborah O&#146;Connor, the former OfficeMax Senior Vice President and CFO, as co-CFOs for the combined company. On December&nbsp;2, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Newman
retired from the company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the Change in Control Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Newman dated
December&nbsp;17, 2010, as amended by the February&nbsp;21 2013 letter agreement, and the General Release Agreement between the company and Mr.&nbsp;Newman dated December&nbsp;11, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Newman received the following severance benefits:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$492,428, which equates to his 2013 annual bonus, calculated at target and pro-rated for the period of time worked in 2013;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$2,328,100, which equates to two times the sum of his annual base salary in effect on the termination date plus his 2013 target annual bonus;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$15,879, which equates to 18 months of the company&#146;s monthly COBRA premium in effect for the type of coverage in effect for him on the termination
date; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable agreements and respective plans.</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Robert Moore, Former Executive Vice

severance benefits to which Mr.&nbsp;Moore may be entitled. Mr. Moore&#146;s employment with the company terminated on December 27, 2013, and Mr. Moore became entitled to receive a payment of $500,000, which payment will be made on June 30, 2014.

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc692145_80"></A>TABULAR INFORMATION REGARDING POTENTIAL PAYMENTS UPON

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following tables quantify the potential termination and change in control payment amounts assuming a hypothetical triggering event had occurred under each of the NEO employment agreements, change in
control agreements and equity plans as of December&nbsp;28, 2013. The terms and conditions of the post-employment and change in control provisions for each of the NEOs are described in detail above. </FONT></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Mr.&nbsp;Smith was appointed Chairman and CEO of the company on November&nbsp;13, 2013, subsequent to the merger with OfficeMax. Therefore, Mr. Smith is not within a
change in control period, which means that his termination of employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013 would be considered to be a termination prior to the occurrence of a change in control. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2003 OMIPP. Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s 2013 Restricted Stock Unit Award
Agreement and 2013 Performance Share Award Agreement supersede the terms of the 2003 OMIPP as it relates to retirement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Represents the Initial Performance Bonus as outlined in Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s Employment Agreement. Because Mr.&nbsp;Smith was not eligible to receive an annual bonus
for the 2013 fiscal year, he would not be entitled to receive payment of a pro-rata annual bonus for the year of termination if his employment was terminated due to death or Disability (as defined in his Employment Agreement) on December&nbsp;27,
2013. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">In the event of his involuntary separation from service with the company due to death or Disability (as defined in his Employment Agreement), or his separation from
service with the company without Cause or for Good Reason, in either case within 12 months following a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Smith will fully vest in his 2013 RSU award on the date of his termination. The amount included in the table reflects
the number of shares that would vest multiplied by the closing stock price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;27, 2013 of $5.19. The stock options held by Mr. Smith would vest upon these events, however, because such stock options are
considered &#147;underwater&#148; on December 27, 2013, no value is reflected in the above table for the accelerated vesting of such stock options. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">In the event of his separation from service with the company without Cause or for Good Reason, in either case prior to the effective date of a change in control,
Mr.&nbsp;Smith will vest in his 2013 RSU award, prorated for service performed from the grant date through his termination date. The amount included in the table reflects the number of shares that would vest multiplied by the closing stock price of
the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;27, 2013 of $5.19. The stock options held by Mr. Smith would vest upon these events with respect to the portion of the award that would vest within the 12 month period following termination, but because such
stock options are considered &#147;underwater&#148; on December 27, 2013, no value is reflected in the above table for the vesting of such stock options. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Reflects a payment under Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s Employment Agreement, dated November&nbsp;12, 2013, equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of
Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s base salary in effect on December&nbsp;27, 2013 and Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s target annual bonus, payable in a lump sum, and (ii)&nbsp;18 months of reimbursement of the monthly COBRA premium, based on the rate in effect on the
date of his termination. Because Mr.&nbsp;Smith was not eligible to receive an annual bonus for the 2013 fiscal year, he would not be entitled to receive payment of two times the target annual bonus as described in the preceding sentence if his
employment was terminated on December&nbsp;27, 2013. In the event of a change in control, as defined under Section 280G of the Code, and a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013, the total payments for
Mr.&nbsp;Smith under the foregoing arrangement equal $9,043,556, including $6,226,007 for the accelerated vesting of his restricted stock. However, these payments are subject to reduction if the parachute amounts associated with the payments under
Section 280G of the Code equal or exceed three times Mr.&nbsp;Smith&#146;s average taxable compensation received from the company for the five-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2013, and if he would
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">79 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">
receive more on an after tax basis by reducing the payments than he would receive by getting all the payments and paying the 20% excise tax imposed by Section 4999 of the Code. Under the
provisions, the cash severance portion of his payments would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary to bring the total of all the payments to a level where the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction in the severance payment
would be $383,543 and after this reduction the total payments to Mr.&nbsp;Smith would equal $8,660,013. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px; "><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Stephen

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Mr.&nbsp;Hare was appointed CFO of the company on December&nbsp;2, 2013, subsequent to the merger with OfficeMax. Therefore, Mr. Hare is not within a change in control
period, which means that his termination of employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013 would be considered to be a termination prior to the occurrence of a change in control. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Retirement is generally treated as a voluntary termination for all programs and agreements except the 2003 OMIPP. Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s 2013 Restricted Stock Unit Award
Agreement and 2013 Performance Share Award Agreement supersede the terms of the 2003 OMIPP as it relates to retirement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">In the event of his involuntary separation from service with the company due to death or Disability (as defined in his 2013 Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement), or
his separation from service with the company without Cause or for Good Reason, in either case prior to the effective date of a change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Hare will vest in his 2013 RSU award, prorated for service performed from the grant date
through his termination date. The amount included in the table reflects the number of shares that would vest multiplied by the closing stock price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;27, 2013 of $5.19. The stock options held by
Mr.&nbsp;Hare that would vest upon his involuntary separation from service with the company due to death or Disability, or his separation from service with the company without Cause or for Good Reason are considered &#147;underwater&#148; on
December&nbsp;27, 2013, and therefore no value is reflected in the above table for the accelerated vesting of such stock options. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Reflects a lump sum payment under Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s Letter Agreement, dated December&nbsp;2, 2013, equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;18 times the amount of
Mr.&nbsp;Hare&#146;s monthly base salary at the rate in effect on December&nbsp;27, 2013, (ii)&nbsp;18 times the difference between the company&#146;s monthly COBRA charge for the type of company-provided group health plan coverage in effect on that
date for Mr.&nbsp;Hare and his active employee charge for such coverage, and (iii)&nbsp;a pro-rata bonus calculated based on actual performance under the company&#146;s annual bonus plan for the fiscal year in which the termination occurs. Because
this table represents a hypothetical termination date of December&nbsp;27, 2013, and Mr.&nbsp;Hare is not eligible for an annual bonus for fiscal year 2013 performance, he is not eligible to receive an amount in respect of item (iii)&nbsp;in the
preceding sentence. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">As of December&nbsp;27, 2013, Mr.&nbsp;Hare had not entered in to a change in control agreement with the company. Therefore, the benefits he is entitled to receive in
connection with an involuntary termination without Cause or a resignation for Good Reason upon or after a change in control are identical to those he is entitled to receive under his Letter Agreement in connection with an involuntary termination
without Cause or a resignation for Good Reason. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(4)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Total for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>6,369,302</B></FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On February&nbsp;21, 2013, in connection with the signing of the Merger Agreement by the company, Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement with the company
was amended so that the occurrence of the &#147;Closing,&#148; as defined in the Merger Agreement, will be deemed to constitute a &#147;Change in Control&#148; for purposes of his Change in Control Agreement. Therefore, a hypothetical involuntary
termination without Cause or resignation for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013 would result in a severance payout under the terms of his Change in Control Agreement. Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is not entitled to receive a severance payment resulting from
a termination for any other reason during the change in control period, which continues until the second anniversary of the Closing. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with the Omnibus Amendment, all of Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s restricted stock and stock option awards that were granted to him prior to 2013 and that are
unvested as of December&nbsp;27, 2013, would vest immediately upon his termination of employment without Cause or resignation for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013. In the case of the 2013 RSU award and the 2013 performance share award,
two-thirds of the awards would vest upon termination following a change in control without Cause or for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013, in accordance with their respective award agreements. The vesting terms under these award agreements are
discussed in more detail under the &#147;2013 Long-Term Incentive Program&#148; section. The value reflected represents the number of shares that would vest multiplied by the closing stock price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;27, 2013
of $5.19. The stock options held by Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt that would vest upon his termination without Cause or resignation for Good Reason are considered &#147;underwater&#148; on December&nbsp;27, 2013, and therefore no value is reflected in the table
above for the accelerated vesting of such stock options. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a lump sum payment under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, dated December&nbsp;16, 2010, and amended on February&nbsp;21, 2013, equal to the
sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;27, 2013, and Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s 2013 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s pro-rated 2013 target bonus,
and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;27, 2013 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt on December&nbsp;27, 2013. Under Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s Change in Control Agreement,
if his termination is due to death or disability after the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is entitled to his pro-rated 2013 target bonus, which is $573,750. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt is entitled to a payment under his Change in Control
Agreement of an annual bonus at least equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect to the 2010, 2011 and 2012 fiscal years, provided that he was employed by the company at the end of the 2013 fiscal year. The highest
annual bonus earned by Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt under the bonus plan during these three fiscal years was earned by him during the 2012 fiscal year in the amount of $488,625. The actual bonus earned by Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt for the 2013 fiscal year was $516,375.
It should be noted that the change in control discussed in Footnote 1 is not considered a Change in Control as defined in Section&nbsp;280G of the Code. In the event of a change in control, as defined under Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, and a
termination of Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013, the total payments for Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt under the foregoing arrangement equal $6,369,302, including $3,220,973 for the accelerated vesting of his restricted stock. However,
these payments are subject to reduction if the parachute amounts associated with the payments under Section&nbsp;280G of the Code equal or exceed three times Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt&#146;s average taxable compensation received from the company for the
five-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2013, and if he would receive more on an after tax basis by reducing the payments than he would receive by getting all the payments and paying the 20% excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
Under the provisions, the cash severance portion of his payments would be reduced by the minimum amount necessary to bring the total of all the payments to a level where the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction in the
severance payment would be $63,067 and after this reduction the total payments to Mr.&nbsp;Schmidt would equal $6,306,235. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">81 </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Total for Ms.&nbsp;Garcia</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>$</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>4,239,926</B></FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On February&nbsp;21, 2013, in connection with the signing of the Merger Agreement by the company, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s Change in Control Agreement with the company
was amended so that the occurrence of the &#147;Closing,&#148; as defined in the Merger Agreement, will be deemed to constitute a &#147;Change in Control&#148; for purposes of her Change in Control Agreement. Therefore, a hypothetical involuntary
termination without Cause or resignation for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013 would result in a severance payout under the terms of her Change in Control Agreement. Ms.&nbsp;Garcia is not entitled to receive a severance payment resulting from a
termination for any other reason during the change in control period, which continues until the second anniversary of the Closing. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects the value of a 24-month outplacement services package under Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s Change in Control Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with the Omnibus Amendment, all of Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s restricted stock and stock option awards that were granted prior to 2013 and that are unvested
as of December&nbsp;27, 2013, would vest immediately upon her termination of employment without Cause or resignation for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013. In the case of the 2013 RSU award and the 2013 performance share award, two-thirds of the
awards would vest upon termination following a change in control without Cause or for Good Reason on December&nbsp;27, 2013, in accordance with their respective award agreements. The vesting terms under these award agreements are discussed in more
detail under the &#147;2013 Long-Term Incentive Program&#148; section. The value reflected represents the number of shares that would vest multiplied by the closing stock price of the company&#146;s stock on December&nbsp;27, 2013 of $5.19. The
stock options held by Ms.&nbsp;Garcia that would vest upon her termination of employment without Cause or resignation for Good Reason are considered &#147;underwater&#148; on December&nbsp;27, 2013, and therefore no value is reflected in the table
above for the accelerated vesting of such stock options. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reflects a lump sum payment under Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s Change in Control Agreement, dated December&nbsp;17, 2010 and amended on February&nbsp;21,
2013, equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;two times the sum of Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s base salary (including car allowance) in effect on December&nbsp;27, 2013 and Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s 2013 target bonus, (ii)&nbsp;Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s pro-rated 2013
target bonus, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;27, 2013 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Ms.&nbsp;Garcia on December&nbsp;27, 2013. Under Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s Change in Control
Agreement, if her termination is due to death or Disability after the change in control, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia is entitled to her pro-rated 2013 target bonus, which is $431,250. In addition, Ms.&nbsp;Garcia is entitled to a payment under her Change in
Control Agreement of an annual bonus at least equal to her highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect to the 2010, 2011 and 2012 fiscal years, provided that she was employed by the company at the end of the 2013 fiscal year. The
highest annual bonus earned by Ms.&nbsp;Garcia under the bonus plan during these three fiscal years was earned by her during the 2012 fiscal year in the amount of $300,737. The actual bonus earned by Ms.&nbsp;Garcia for the 2013 fiscal year was
$315,000. It should be noted that the Change in Control discussed in Footnote 1 is not considered a change in control as defined in Section&nbsp;280G of the Code. In the event of a change in control, as defined under Section 280G of the Code, and a
termination of Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013, the total payments for Ms.&nbsp;Garcia under the foregoing arrangement equal $4,239,926, including $1,712,909 for the accelerated vesting of her restricted stock. However,
these payments are subject to reduction if the parachute amounts associated with the payments under Section 280G of the Code </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">82 </FONT></P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
equal or exceed three times Ms.&nbsp;Garcia&#146;s average taxable compensation received from the company for the five-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2013, and if she would receive more on
an after tax basis by reducing the payments than she would receive by getting all the payments and paying the 20% excise tax imposed by Section 4999 of the Code. Under the provisions, the cash severance portion of her payments would be reduced by
the minimum amount necessary to bring the total of all the payments to a level where the 20% excise tax is not triggered. The amount of the reduction in the severance payment would be $467,684 and after this reduction the total payments to
Ms.&nbsp;Garcia would equal $3,772,242. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Michael Allison </B></FONT></P>

target bonus, and (iii)&nbsp;the product of 18 and the monthly COBRA premium on December&nbsp;27, 2013 for the type of group health plan coverage in effect for Mr.&nbsp;Allison on December&nbsp;27, 2013. Under Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s Change in
Control Agreement, if his termination is due to death or disability </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">83 </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
after the change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Allison is entitled to his pro-rated 2013 target bonus, which is $393,750. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Allison is entitled to a payment under his Change in Control
Agreement of an annual bonus at least equal to his highest annual bonus earned under the bonus plan with respect to the 2010, 2011 and 2012 fiscal years; provided that, he was employed by the company at the end of the 2013 fiscal year. The highest
annual bonus earned by Mr.&nbsp;Allison under the bonus plan during these three fiscal years was earned by him during the 2012 fiscal year in the amount of $202,125. The actual bonus earned for the 2013 fiscal year was $283,500. It should be noted
that the change in control discussed in Footnote 1 is not considered a change in control as defined in Section&nbsp;280G of the Code. In the event of a Change in Control, as defined under Section 280G of the Code, and a termination of
Mr.&nbsp;Allison&#146;s employment on December&nbsp;27, 2013, the total payments for Mr.&nbsp;Allison under the foregoing arrangement equal $4,527,432, including $1,712,915 for the accelerated vesting of his restricted stock. This payment would
trigger an excise tax under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code in the amount of $619,326 in addition to normal income and employment taxes. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;28, 2013, 19,962,941 shares were issuable under the 2007 Plan and 31,408,135 shares were issuable under the 2003 OMIPP. However, the shares
available for future grants under the 2003 OMIPP are limited to new employees of the company and legacy OfficeMax employees. For further discussion of the 2003 OMIPP, please see the section, &#147;Summary of Executive Agreements and Potential
Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control &#150; Summary of 2003 OMIPP.&#148; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The number of shares reported includes 4,604,474 performance share units reserved at target. In the event that the performance share units are not paid at maximum,
additional shares will be available for future issuance under the company&#146;s equity compensation plans. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">85 </FONT></P>
